Summarise the specification curve results

summarise_specs.Rd

This function allows to inspect results of the specification curves by returning a comparatively simple summary of the results. These results can be returned for specific analytical choices.

summarise_specs(df, var = estimate, stats = lst(median, mad, min, max,
  q25 = function(x) quantile(x, prob = 0.25), q75 = function(x) quantile(x,
  prob = 0.75)), group = NULL)

Arguments

df

a data frame containing the choices and results of each specification (resulting from run_specs).
var

which variable should be evaluated? Defaults to estimate (the effect sizes computed by run_specs). No need to use closures.
stats

list object (lst()) of summary functions.
group

a grouping factor (e.g., "subsets"). Several grouping variables can be passed. Defaults to NULL.

Examples

# Run specification curve analysis
results <- run_specs(df = example_data,
                     y = c("y1", "y2"),
                     x = c("x1", "x2"),
                     model = c("lm"),
                     controls = c("c1", "c2"),
                     subsets = list(group1 = unique(example_data$group1),
                                    group2 = unique(example_data$group2)))

# Basic example
summarise_specs(results)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 7
#>   median   mad   min   max   q25   q75   obs
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1   3.59  4.56 -2.05  9.58  1.03  7.63   123

# Summary of specific analytical choices
summarise_specs(results, group = c("subsets", "x"))
#> Joining, by = c("subsets", "x")
#> # A tibble: 24 x 9
#> # Groups:   subsets [12]
#>    subsets                 x     median   mad     min   max     q25   q75   obs
#>    <chr>                   <chr>  <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 all                     x1      3.34 4.71  -0.0545  6.92  0.283   6.50   500
#>  2 all                     x2      4.48 4.66   1.09    8.14  1.34    7.67   500
#>  3 group1 = 0              x1      2.65 3.90  -0.227   5.85  0.0336  5.24   250
#>  4 group1 = 0              x2      4.05 4.33   0.653   8.07  1.29    7.08   250
#>  5 group1 = 0 & group2 = A x1      3.30 0.716  2.26    4.24  2.80    3.64    72
#>  6 group1 = 0 & group2 = A x2      4.06 4.24   0.482   8.20  1.52    6.88    72
#>  7 group1 = 0 & group2 = B x1      3.86 4.63   0.0819  8.96  1.06    7.10    76
#>  8 group1 = 0 & group2 = B x2      4.21 4.50   0.603   8.75  1.33    7.40    76
#>  9 group1 = 0 & group2 = C x1      1.41 4.72  -1.92    4.92 -1.76    4.61   102
#> 10 group1 = 0 & group2 = C x2      3.72 4.58   0.299   7.57  0.753   6.58   102
#> # … with 14 more rows

# Summare of other estimates
summarise_specs(results, var = "p.value", group = "controls")
#> Joining, by = "controls"
#> # A tibble: 4 x 8
#>   controls             median          mad      min   max      q25     q75   obs
#>   <chr>                 <dbl>        <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 c1            0.0000287          4.25e-5 9.94e-47 0.921 1.55e- 8 0.00997   123
#> 2 c1 + c2       0.00000000671      9.94e-9 5.08e-89 0.862 3.67e-18 0.00219   123
#> 3 c2            0.0000275          4.07e-5 8.09e-63 0.994 1.28e-13 0.0817    123
#> 4 no covariates 0.000484           7.17e-4 8.62e-40 0.656 3.81e- 9 0.0597    123
